This PR is to fix a crash issue while removing port from orchagent portsorch.cpp. The crash is at line https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/blob/65323ca51db8947e8a39db5c9c0ef1fe4b27a59f/syncd/SaiSwitch.cpp#L1105 . Error flow like this:

orchagent calls portsorch.cpp::removePortBulk:

    a. it removes port serdes first by calling removePortSerdesAttribute, this will remove serdes from VIDTORID and RIDTOVID

    b. it continues and calls remove port which will call Syncd.cpp::processOidRemove

    c. In Syncd.cpp::processOidRemove, it calls SaiSwitch.cpp::collectPortRelatedObjects

    d. In SaiSwitch.cpp::collectPortRelatedObjects, it gets serdes object as a related object to the port. As serdes object does not allow null, it gets a real object ID.

    e. It calls SaiSwitch.cpp::postPortRemove, and it calls getVidForRid for each related object

    f. As serdes VID RID mapping has been removed by step#a, it crashes at  https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/blob/65323ca51db8947e8a39db5c9c0ef1fe4b27a59f/syncd/SaiSwitch.cpp#L1109

> Couple of questions for my understanding
> 
> * In step d, what OID is being returned here ? The serdes OID that has been deleted ?
> * With this fix, portRelatedObjects will not contain the serdes object anymore ?

1. serdes OID. The RIDTOVID mapping has been deleted
2. yes. With the fix, Vendor SAI is allowed to return NULL object ID after removing serdes, and NULL object ID would not be added to portRelatedObjects

Hi @JaiOCP,

Many thanks for the interesting discussing and comments during the call. 

Regarding the comment of leveraging saitam.h for Path Tracing, that makes a lot of sense for some Path Tracing Nodes (e.g., Source Node) to create the probe instances of Path Tracing and configure the different parameters of each instance. All of probe instances can be maintained under the Path Tracing SAI object. 

However, the SAI attributes in this PR (Interface ID, and Time Template) are port attributes even if they are specific to Path Tracing. Adding the proposed port attributes under PT TAM Object, would require maintaining port list under the PT TAM to hold the two new port attributes. The list of ports under PT TAM will be just another a copy of the list of port under SAI Port. 
In addition, we would need a logic to keep these two same list of ports in sync: 
-	When port get assigned an ID, before we create the port under PT TAM, we have cross check the existence of the port in SAI port.
-	When a port is deleted from SAI port, we need to make sure it gets deleted from PT TAM as well. 
This makes the orchagent logic more complex and require lots of cross checks. 
Having the ID and Time template under SAI Port avoid these cross checks logic as they are property of the port. 

SAI TAM would for sure make sense for other roles like PT Source.

> 
> Many thanks for the interesting discussing and comments during the call.

> Regarding the comment of leveraging saitam.h for Path Tracing, that makes a lot of sense for some Path Tracing Nodes (e.g., Source Node) to create the probe instances of Path Tracing and configure the different parameters of each instance. All of probe instances can be maintained under the Path Tracing SAI object.
> 
> However, the SAI attributes in this PR (Interface ID, and Time Template) are port attributes even if they are specific to Path Tracing. Adding the proposed port attributes under PT TAM Object, would require maintaining port list under the PT TAM to hold the two new port attributes. The list of ports under PT TAM will be just another a copy of the list of port under SAI Port. In addition, we would need a logic to keep these two same list of ports in sync:
> 
> * When port get assigned an ID, before we create the port under PT TAM, we have cross check the existence of the port in SAI port.
> * When a port is deleted from SAI port, we need to make sure it gets deleted from PT TAM as well.
>   This makes the orchagent logic more complex and require lots of cross checks.
>   Having the ID and Time template under SAI Port avoid these cross checks logic as they are property of the port.
> 
> SAI TAM would for sure make sense for other roles like PT Source.
> 
> Thanks Ahmed

Here is a suggestion. Its only a 2 line change to use TAM.
1. Add new INT type SAI_TAM_INT_TYPE_PT in sai_tam_int_type_t
https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/39b7fe093d3f58f2b5bb037ac8dba94bf92f74ab/inc/saitam.h#L479

2. Add SAI_PORT_ATTR_PATH_TRACING_TIMESTAMP_TYPE in  sai_tam_int_attr_t
https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/39b7fe093d3f58f2b5bb037ac8dba94bf92f74ab/inc/saitam.h#L805

- TAM object is already part of port attribute. If TAM object is created for port then that port is enabled for path tracing.
https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/39b7fe093d3f58f2b5bb037ac8dba94bf92f74ab/inc/saiport.h#L1592

- There is no need to create a new device id. There is already a device id attribute present and you can just use it. But if you need port id then that can be added as port attribute
https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/39b7fe093d3f58f2b5bb037ac8dba94bf92f74ab/inc/saitam.h#L535

Workflow will be something like this.
1. Configure tam object with int type as PT
2. Configure tam attribute for choosing the PTP bits
3. Configure port id
4. Attach the tam object to port or set of ports: This enables the feature on that port.
5. Since this is a transit function no other tam attribute or object need to created

Hi @JaiOCP,

Thanks for the review and also for your comments/clarifications. Another question: If a TAM object attribute (e.g TIMESTAMP_TYPE) is modified, does the SAI implementation iterate over all the associated ports and modify it on the port? Also, handle other events, e.g if a port is removed, then does SAI remove the port from the list of ports that use this TAM object? In other words, does SAI maintain state to ensure the relationship between ports and TAM objects?

@rlhui @JaiOCP @aparnapattekar-gh @kcudnik 
Could we use some time at the beginning of next SAI meeting (August 17) to discuss the open questions related to this PR ?

1. If time stamp attribute in TAM has changed then all the associated port objects need to walked by SAI adapter. This is no different than from e.g. nexthop walks for a given nexthop group or route object. There is no state maintained in SAI.2. If port is removed then It’s reference to TAM object is also removed. For the table level mask, there will not be any value to specify. Hence it is of type sai_acl_field_data_mask_t. 1) can you please specify if all acl actions applicable to ingress stage are applicable to post ingress as well? or is there restriction for any of them?
2) can you please specify expected behavior of result action when packet is a match in both ingress stage and post-ingress stage.

> 1. can you please specify if all acl actions applicable to ingress stage are applicable to post ingress as well? or is there restriction for any of them?

>    eg. if there is a packet match in ingress stage as well post-ingress and each stage resulting actions are different mirror session ids, what should be an expected behavior?

Thanks for the comments.
1. The spec do not specify and restrictions for match or action types in post ingress stage. If implementations cannot support certain action type, it will be reflected in the capability query for the stage just like existing stages. https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/master/inc/saitypes.h#L809
2. Since post ingress stage is the later one, the actions from post ingress will override the actions from ingress stage in case of conflict

Hi,

Objective of PR: When a physical interface's operational status change, how should host interface'e operational status be updated?

It is not clear to us what SAI/SONiC agreed-upon/expected path to update the host interface operational state is when physical interface's operational status changes, so opening this PR to initiate that discuss and get consensus on that.

When physical interface's operation status changes, which component controls the update of operational status of host interface? 

1) Does portsOrch control the update of host interface operational state using sai_hostif_api API (SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS) when OrchAgent receives physical interface's operational status change notification? or
2)  is it expected for some other components (for example: vendor SAI/SDK) to internally control and update the host interface operational state and thus making portsOrch's sai_hostif_api 
 API (SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS) call pretty much as override call that vendor SAI may honor or just ignore it as no-op? or
3) something else.

Thank you.
CC:  @eddyk-nvidia @mikeberesford @lguohan
@marian-pritsak , woudl you like to review/approve this?  Thanks.

Syncd Notification Consumer upon getting the link status change from SAI sends  SAI_SWITCH_NOTIFICATION_NAME_PORT_STATE_CHANGE event which is handled by Notification Consumer in PortsOrch::doTask. This task calls setHostIntsOperStatus() which eventually invokes the SAI-Redis API sai_hositf_api->set_hostif_attribute() with SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS. So, IMO your #1 in the original comment is correct

In SAI_SWITCH_HOSTIF_OPER_STATUS_UPDATE_MODE_APPLICATION mode when hostif created using create_hostif(), It is application's responsibility to query the corresponding physical interface's state from whatever source of truth is for them and update the state for hostif with SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS either in same create_hostif() call or using hostif set_hostif_attribute() API after create_hostif() call depending on NOS's implementation.
